cabinet.name: Kumar Ingnam
ministriesNp: भूमि व्यवस्थापन, सहकारी तथा गरिबी निवारण

executive.title: Executive
executive.description: Implements laws and runs the government
executive.descriptionNp: कानून कार्यान्वयन गर्ने र सरकार चलाउने

houses.name: National Assembly
houses.composition: 56 elected from provinces + 3 nominated by President

judiciary.title: Judiciary
judiciary.descriptionNp: कानूनको व्याख्या गर्ने र न्याय प्रदान गर्ने

constitutionRef.partTitle: Structure of State and Distribution of State Power

levels.description: 7 provinces with elected assemblies and governments
levels.descriptionNp: ७ प्रदेश निर्वाचित सभा र सरकारहरू सहित

levels.breakdown: 6 Metropolitan Cities + 11 Sub-metropolitan + 276 Municipalities + 460 Rural Municipalities

steps.title: Bill Introduction
steps.description: Government or MP introduces bill in either house
steps.descriptionNp: सरकार वा सांसदले कुनै पनि सदनमा विधेयक प्रस्तुत गर्छ

steps.title: Committee Review
steps.description: Relevant parliamentary committee examines the bill
steps.descriptionNp: सम्बन्धित संसदीय समितिले विधेयक जाँच गर्छ

steps.title: House Debate
steps.description: Full house debates and votes on the bill
steps.descriptionNp: पूर्ण सदनले विधेयकमा छलफल र मतदान गर्छ

steps.title: Second House
steps.description: Bill goes to other house for approval
steps.descriptionNp: विधेयक स्वीकृतिको लागि अर्को सदनमा जान्छ

steps.title: Joint Sitting
steps.description: If houses disagree, joint sitting resolves differences
steps.descriptionNp: सदनहरू असहमत भएमा संयुक्त बैठकले मतभेद समाधान गर्छ

steps.title: Presidential Assent
steps.description: President signs bill into law within 15 days
steps.descriptionNp: राष्ट्रपतिले १५ दिनभित्र विधेयकमा हस्ताक्षर गरी कानून बनाउँछ

specialBills.note: Can only be introduced in House of Representatives
specialBills.noteNp: प्रतिनिधि सभामा मात्र प्रस्तुत गर्न सकिन्छ

elections.title: Election System
elections.description: Nepal uses a mixed electoral system combining direct voting and proportional representation to balance local accountability with inclusive representation.
elections.descriptionNp: नेपालले स्थानीय जवाफदेहिता र समावेशी प्रतिनिधित्व बीच सन्तुलन कायम गर्न प्रत्यक्ष मतदान र समानुपातिक प्रतिनिधित्व मिलाएको मिश्रित निर्वाचन प्रणाली प्रयोग गर्छ।

electoralSystem.title: Mixed Electoral System
electoralSystem.explanation: Nepal combines two voting methods to achieve both geographic representation and social inclusion. You cast TWO votes in federal elections.
electoralSystem.explanationNp: नेपालले भौगोलिक प्रतिनिधित्व र सामाजिक समावेशीकरण दुवै हासिल गर्न दुई मतदान विधि मिलाएको छ। संघीय निर्वाचनमा तपाईं दुई वोट दिनुहुन्छ।

systems.name: First-Past-The-Post (FPTP)
systems.howItWorks: Vote for a CANDIDATE. Whoever gets the most votes wins—even without majority.
systems.howItWorksNp: उम्मेदवारलाई मत दिनुहोस्। सबैभन्दा बढी मत पाउनेले जित्छ—बहुमत नभए पनि।
systems.purpose: Ensures geographic representation—your MP is accountable to YOUR area.
systems.purposeNp: भौगोलिक प्रतिनिधित्व सुनिश्चित गर्छ—तपाईंको सांसद तपाईंको क्षेत्रप्रति जवाफदेही हुन्छ।
systems.criticism: A candidate can win with just 30% of votes if opponents split the rest.
systems.criticismNp: यदि प्रतिद्वन्द्वीहरूले बाँकी मत विभाजन गरे भने उम्मेदवारले ३०% मतले जित्न सक्छ।

systems.name: Proportional Representation (PR)
systems.howItWorks: Vote for a PARTY. Seats are distributed based on vote share from closed party lists.
systems.howItWorksNp: दललाई मत दिनुहोस्। बन्द पार्टी सूचीबाट मत हिस्साको आधारमा सिटहरू वितरण गरिन्छ।
systems.purpose: Ensures inclusion of women, Dalits, Janajatis, Madhesis, and marginalized groups.
systems.purposeNp: महिला, दलित, आदिवासी जनजाति, मधेसी र सीमान्तकृत समूहको समावेश सुनिश्चित गर्छ।
systems.criticism: Voters don't choose specific candidates—party leadership decides the list order.
systems.criticismNp: मतदाताले विशेष उम्मेदवार छान्दैनन्—दल नेतृत्वले सूची क्रम निर्णय गर्छ।
systems.inclusionRequirement: At least 1/3 of total elected members from each party must be women.
systems.inclusionRequirementNp: प्रत्येक दलबाट निर्वाचित कुल सदस्यको कम्तीमा एक तिहाइ महिला हुनुपर्छ।

whyBothSystems.question: Why keep both systems?
whyBothSystems.answer: FPTP alone would exclude marginalized groups who can't win in their districts. PR alone would weaken geographic accountability—MPs wouldn't answer to specific areas. The mix attempts to balance both needs.
whyBothSystems.answerNp: FPTP मात्रले आफ्नो जिल्लामा जित्न नसक्ने सीमान्तकृत समूहहरूलाई बहिष्कृत गर्नेछ। PR मात्रले भौगोलिक जवाफदेहिता कमजोर पार्नेछ—सांसदहरू विशेष क्षेत्रलाई जवाफ दिने छैनन्। मिश्रणले दुवै आवश्यकता सन्तुलन गर्ने प्रयास गर्छ।

levels.note: National Assembly (राष्ट्रिय सभा) is NOT directly elected by public—it's chosen by provincial assemblies and local representatives.
levels.noteNp: राष्ट्रिय सभा जनताद्वारा प्रत्यक्ष निर्वाचित हुँदैन—यो प्रदेश सभा र स्थानीय प्रतिनिधिहरूद्वारा छानिन्छ।

levels.note: Most direct impact on daily life—controls local services, land records, vital registration.
levels.noteNp: दैनिक जीवनमा सबैभन्दा प्रत्यक्ष प्रभाव—स्थानीय सेवा, जग्गा अभिलेख, अभिलेखन नियन्त्रण गर्छ।

electionCommission.title: Election Commission
electionCommission.role: Independent constitutional body that conducts, supervises, directs, and controls elections.
electionCommission.roleNp: निर्वाचन सञ्चालन, पर्यवेक्षण, निर्देशन र नियन्त्रण गर्ने स्वतन्त्र संवैधानिक निकाय।
electionCommission.appointment: Appointed by President on recommendation of Constitutional Council
electionCommission.independence: Supposed to be independent, though its neutrality is often questioned in practice.
electionCommission.independenceNp: स्वतन्त्र हुनुपर्ने, तर व्यवहारमा यसको तटस्थता प्रायः प्रश्न गरिन्छ।

voterEligibility.title: Who Can Vote
voterEligibility.votingMethod: Paper ballots—Nepal does not use electronic voting due to trust and infrastructure concerns.
voterEligibility.votingMethodNp: कागजी मतपत्र—विश्वास र पूर्वाधार सम्बन्धी चिन्ताका कारण नेपालले इलेक्ट्रोनिक मतदान प्रयोग गर्दैन।

governmentFormation.title: Government Formation
governmentFormation.subtitle: Winning elections ≠ forming government
governmentFormation.explanation: Nepal follows a parliamentary system. The Prime Minister is chosen by the House, not directly elected by the public.
governmentFormation.explanationNp: नेपालले संसदीय प्रणाली पालना गर्छ। प्रधानमन्त्री सदनद्वारा छानिन्छ, जनताद्वारा प्रत्यक्ष निर्वाचित हुँदैन।

process.title: Election Results
process.description: House of Representatives election results are declared
process.descriptionNp: प्रतिनिधि सभाको निर्वाचन परिणाम घोषणा हुन्छ

process.title: Majority Check
process.description: If one party has 138+ seats (absolute majority), its leader becomes PM
process.descriptionNp: यदि एक दलसँग १३८+ सिट (पूर्ण बहुमत) छ भने, त्यसको नेता प्रधानमन्त्री हुन्छ

process.title: Coalition Building
process.description: If no majority, parties negotiate to form coalition with combined 138+ seats
process.descriptionNp: बहुमत नभएमा, दलहरूले संयुक्त १३८+ सिट सहित गठबन्धन बनाउन वार्ता गर्छन्

process.title: PM Appointment
process.description: President appoints the leader who commands majority support
process.descriptionNp: राष्ट्रपतिले बहुमत समर्थन प्राप्त नेतालाई नियुक्त गर्छ

process.title: Vote of Confidence
process.description: PM must win confidence vote within 30 days of appointment
process.descriptionNp: प्रधानमन्त्रीले नियुक्तिको ३० दिनभित्र विश्वासको मत जित्नुपर्छ

instability.title: Why Governments Fall Frequently

reasons.explanation: Multi-party coalitions are held together by bargains, not ideology. When bargains fail, coalitions collapse.
reasons.explanationNp: बहुदलीय गठबन्धनहरू विचारधाराले होइन, सौदाबाजीले जोडिएका हुन्छन्। सौदा असफल हुँदा, गठबन्धन भत्किन्छ।

reasons.explanation: Parties frequently split due to internal power struggles, taking MPs with them.
reasons.explanationNp: आन्तरिक शक्ति संघर्षका कारण दलहरू बारम्बार विभाजित हुन्छन्, सांसदहरू लिएर जान्छन्।

reasons.explanation: MPs switching parties for ministerial positions or other benefits.
reasons.explanationNp: मन्त्री पद वा अन्य फाइदाका लागि सांसदहरू दल परिवर्तन गर्छन्।

reasons.explanation: Government can be brought down without agreeing on a replacement first.
reasons.explanationNp: पहिले प्रतिस्थापनमा सहमत नभई सरकार गिराउन सकिन्छ।

instability.criticalQuestion: If elections are frequent but governments unstable, what exactly are citizens 'choosing'?
instability.criticalQuestionNp: यदि निर्वाचन बारम्बार हुन्छ तर सरकारहरू अस्थिर छन् भने, नागरिकहरूले वास्तवमा के 'छान्दैछन्'?
